intents.name: Physical Presence for Company Setup
intents.question: Do I need to be physically present to open a company?
responses: No, physical presence is not required to set up a company at Meydan Free Zone. You can complete the entire incorporation process remotely — from submitting documents to getting your license. Many of our clients set up their companies from abroad without ever stepping foot in Dubai.

Good news — you don't need to be in Dubai to open your company. The whole process at Meydan Free Zone can be done remotely. Document submission, KYC, approvals — all handled online through our portal. You only need to be in the UAE later if you're applying for a residence visa and need to complete medical and Emirates ID procedures.

Physical presence isn't required for company incorporation at Meydan Free Zone. Everything from license application to document signing can be done remotely. The only time you'd need to be in the UAE is for residence visa processing — specifically for the medical test and Emirates ID biometrics.

intents.name: Share Capital Requirements
intents.question: Are there any paid-up share capital requirements?
responses: No paid-up share capital is required at Meydan Free Zone. There's also no minimum or maximum share capital requirement — you decide what makes sense for your business. The only rule is that share allocation and total share capital must be whole numbers, not fractions. So 45% or 46% is fine, but 45.5% wouldn't work.

There are zero paid-up share capital requirements. You're free to set your share capital at whatever amount suits your business. Just keep in mind the shares must be whole numbers — no fractions allowed. For example, a 50/50 split works, but 33.33% wouldn't.

Meydan Free Zone doesn't require any paid-up share capital. There's no minimum and no maximum either. Set it at whatever level makes sense for your business needs. One thing to note: share allocation must be whole numbers, not fractions.

intents.name: NOC for Shareholders
intents.question: Do shareholders need NOC to incorporate a company?
responses: No, neither individual nor corporate shareholders need a No Objection Certificate (NOC) to incorporate a company at Meydan Free Zone. You can go ahead and set up your company without any NOC requirements from current employers or other entities.

NOC is not required. Whether you're an individual or a corporate shareholder, you can incorporate a company at Meydan Free Zone without any No Objection Certificate. This makes the process much simpler compared to some other jurisdictions.
You don't need a NOC to incorporate at Meydan Free Zone — this applies to both individual and corporate shareholders. No approval needed from your current employer or any other entity to get started.

intents.name: Zero Visa License
intents.question: Can I apply for a zero visa license?
responses: Yes, absolutely! You can get a license with zero visa allocation at Meydan Free Zone. This is popular with businesses that don't need employee visas — maybe you're running things remotely or already have residency through another company. You still get the full license benefits without the visa overhead.

Yes, zero-visa licenses are available at Meydan Free Zone. It's a great option if you don't need to sponsor any employees or yourself on a visa. You get the full company setup — license, documents, everything — just without the visa allocation.

You can definitely get a zero-visa license. Many clients choose this option when they already have residency elsewhere or plan to run the business remotely. You'll receive the complete license package without any visa quota attached.

intents.name: Combining Business Activities
intents.question: Can I combine commercial, professional, and trading activities?
responses: Yes, you can combine commercial, professional, and trading activities on the same license at Meydan Free Zone. You get 3 groups of activities free of cost during incorporation. If you need more, additional activities cost AED 1,000 each. Approvals are only required for regulated activities.

Absolutely — Meydan Free Zone allows you to mix commercial, professional, and trading activities on one license. The first 3 activity groups are included free. Need more? Each additional activity is AED 1,000. Only regulated activities need special approval.

Yes, the combination of activities is permitted. You can include commercial, professional, and trading activities all on the same license. Three activity groups come free with incorporation; extras are AED 1,000 per activity. The only restriction is regulated activities which need separate approval.

intents.name: Documents After Incorporation
intents.question: What documents do I receive after company incorporation?
responses: After incorporation at Meydan Free Zone, you receive five key documents: 1) Business License, 2) Certificate of Formation, 3) Share Register, 4) Memorandum of Association (MOA), and 5) Lease Agreement. These are your essential company documents for opening bank accounts, entering contracts, and proving your business is legally established.

Upon incorporation, you'll receive: Business License, Certificate of Formation, Share Register, Memorandum of Association, and Lease Agreement. That's your complete company documentation package — everything you need to start operating, open bank accounts, and deal with government entities.

You get five documents after incorporation: your Business License, Certificate of Formation, Share Register, Memorandum of Association (MOA), and Lease Agreement. Note that you can't provide your own MOA, but you can request additions, removals, or edits to clauses in the Meydan MOA — subject to legal approval.

intents.name: Shareholders Limit and Fees
intents.question: How many shareholders are allowed on a license?
responses: A maximum of 100 shareholders are permitted on the license. The first 6 shareholders are included in standard licensing fees. Beyond that, each additional shareholder costs AED 2,000. So for example, if you have 10 shareholders, you'd pay an extra AED 8,000 (4 additional × AED 2,000). There's no minimum or maximum age requirement for shareholders.

You can have up to 100 shareholders on your license. The first 6 are covered in your standard fees. Each additional shareholder from the 7th onward costs AED 2,000. Quick math: 10 shareholders = AED 8,000 extra (4 × AED 2,000). And there's no age restriction — no minimum, no maximum.

The maximum is 100 shareholders per license. Standard licensing fees cover up to 6 shareholders. Beyond that, it's AED 2,000 per additional shareholder. No age restrictions apply — shareholders can be any age. Also, you can be a partner/shareholder in multiple companies simultaneously.

intents.name: Directors and Managers Limit
intents.question: How many directors and managers are allowed?
responses: You can have a maximum of 4 directors and 1 manager on the license. Directors oversee the company's strategic direction while the manager handles day-to-day operations. These limits are per company, not per shareholder.

The limits are: up to 4 directors and 1 manager per license. Directors are responsible for governance and strategic decisions, while the single manager handles operational management. Both are registered on your company documents.
Maximum 4 directors and 1 manager are permitted on each license. That's a straightforward setup — four directors for governance and one manager for operations.

intents.name: Free Activities and Additional Cost
intents.question: How many activities are free and what do extras cost?
responses: You can incorporate your company with 3 groups of activities at no additional charge. If you need more activities beyond those 3 groups, each additional activity costs AED 1,000. Approvals are only required for regulated activities — standard activities can be added without any special permission.

Three activity groups come free with your license. Want more? Each additional activity is AED 1,000. No approvals needed for standard activities — only regulated ones require special permission. This gives you plenty of flexibility to diversify your business offerings.

You get 3 activity groups free during incorporation. Extra activities are AED 1,000 each. Only regulated activities need approval; everything else is straightforward. Most clients find 3 groups more than enough to cover their business needs.

intents.name: Multi-Year License Discount
intents.question: Is there a discount for multi-year license applications?
responses: Yes! There's a standard 15% discount on multi-year license applications of 2 or more years — this applies to both the license and visa allocations. Plus, multi-year license holders get a free amendment. For example, a 2-year license comes with 1 free amendment. The maximum license validity is 10 years.

Multi-year licenses get a 15% discount — available for 2-year terms and above, covering both the license and visa allocations. Bonus: you also get a free amendment with multi-year licenses. So a 2-year license includes 1 free amendment. You can go up to 10 years maximum validity.

Absolutely — book 2 or more years and you get 15% off the license and visa allocation fees. Multi-year licenses also come with a free amendment included. License validity can be set up to a maximum of 10 years, which maximizes your savings with that 15% discount.

intents.name: Multiple Company Ownership
intents.question: Can I be a partner in more than one company?
responses: Yes, you can be a partner or shareholder in multiple companies at Meydan Free Zone. There's no restriction on how many companies you can be involved in. Many entrepreneurs hold stakes in several businesses simultaneously.
Absolutely — there's no limit on how many companies you can be a partner or shareholder in. You're free to diversify your business interests across multiple companies at Meydan Free Zone.

Yes, you can hold shares in multiple companies. Meydan Free Zone doesn't restrict the number of companies you can be a partner or shareholder in. Great for serial entrepreneurs or investors managing a portfolio of businesses.

intents.name: Post Application Steps
intents.question: What happens after submitting the license application?
responses: After you submit your license application on the Meydan portal, all shareholders, the manager, and directors receive an email to complete three tasks: 1) KYC (Know Your Customer) verification, 2) Accept or Reject the application, and 3) Complete the compliance form if applicable. Only once everyone completes their tasks will our team receive the application to review and proceed.

Once the application is submitted, it's over to your team. Shareholders, manager, and directors each get an email with three tasks: KYC verification, Accept/Reject the application, and fill out the compliance form if needed. Our team can only start processing once all parties have completed their tasks. So make sure everyone responds promptly!

The next step after submission is email verification for all stakeholders. intents.name: License Validity Period
intents.question: What is the maximum license validity?
responses: The maximum license validity at Meydan Free Zone is 10 years. You choose the validity period during incorporation — it can be 1 year, 2 years, or up to 10 years. Longer terms get a 15% discount on license and visa allocation fees for 2+ years.
You can set your license validity for up to 10 years. The period is chosen during incorporation. Going for 2 years or more? You'll get a 15% discount on both the license and visa allocation costs.

Maximum license validity is 10 years — you pick the duration during setup. One year is standard, but multi-year options (2-10 years) come with a 15% discount. It's entirely up to you based on your business planning horizon.

intents.name: License Grace Period and Penalties
intents.question: What is the grace period after license expires and what are the penalties?
responses: You get a 30-day grace period from the license expiry date to renew. If you don't renew within that grace period, there's a one-time penalty of AED 500. Important distinction: if you're cancelling the license after it's expired and the grace period has passed, you don't pay the license penalty — but you will still need to pay any immigration card fines if you have one.

The grace period is 30 days after license expiry. Miss that window and you're looking at an AED 500 penalty (one-time fee). Note: this is separate from immigration card penalties. If you're cancelling your license post-expiry, the license penalty is waived, but immigration card fines still apply.

30 days grace period after your license expires. If you haven't renewed by then, it's AED 500 as a one-time penalty. Here's a useful tip: if you're planning to cancel your license after expiry, the license penalty doesn't apply — however, any outstanding immigration card fines (AED 250/month) will still need to be settled.

intents.name: Immigration Card Grace Period and Penalties
intents.question: Is there a grace period for the immigration card?
responses: No, there is no grace period for the immigration card — unlike the license which gives you 30 days. If your immigration card expires, the penalty kicks in immediately at AED 250 per month from the expiry date. The immigration card has the same validity as your business license, so they typically need to be renewed together.

Unfortunately, no grace period for the immigration card. The penalty of AED 250 per month starts right from the expiry date. This is different from the license which gives a 30-day grace. Both the immigration card and visa allocation share the same validity as your business license, so renew them all together.

There's no grace period for the immigration card. Once it expires, you're charged AED 250 per month as a penalty. Make sure to renew it alongside your business license since they share the same validity period. Visa allocations also need annual renewal along with your license and immigration card.

intents.name: Share Allocation Rules
intents.question: Can share allocation be a fraction?
responses: No, share allocation and total share capital cannot be fractions — they must be whole numbers. For example, 45.50% is not allowed; it must be either 45% or 46%. This applies to all share distributions among shareholders. Also, there's no minimum or maximum share capital requirement.

Share allocation must be in whole numbers only, no fractions allowed. So 50/50 works, 70/30 works, but 33.33% doesn't. Same rule for total share capital — whole numbers only. On the plus side, there's no minimum or maximum share capital limit.

Fractions are not permitted in share allocation or total share capital. Everything must be whole numbers — so 45.5% is a no-go, you'd need to round to 45% or 46%. Keep this in mind when distributing shares among multiple shareholders.

intents.name: Company License Address
intents.question: What address appears on the company license?
responses: The address on your license will be: Meydan Grandstand, Next to Meydan Hotel, 6th Floor, Meydan Road, Nad Al Sheba, Dubai, U.A.E. You can request to change the address, but it must remain within the Meydan Free Zone area only.

Your company license will show: Meydan Grandstand, Next to Meydan Hotel, 6th Floor, Meydan Road, Nad Al Sheba, Dubai, U.A.E. If you need a different address, it can be changed but only to another location within the Meydan Free Zone area.

The standard address is Meydan Grandstand, Next to Meydan Hotel, 6th Floor, Meydan Road, Nad Al Sheba, Dubai, U.A.E. Clients can change this address through an amendment, but the new address must be within the Meydan Free Zone area.

intents.name: Audit Financial Statement Timing
intents.question: When do I need to submit the Audit Financial Statement?
responses: The Audit Financial Statement Declaration report is required at the time of license renewal. So you need to have it ready before your renewal date. An audited financial report costs AED 3,000 and takes about 14 business days to prepare, so plan accordingly.

You submit the Audit Financial Statement Declaration at license renewal time. Make sure to prepare this in advance — the audit report takes about 14 business days and costs AED 3,000. It's a prerequisite for getting your renewal processed.

The Audit Financial Statement is due at license renewal. Don't leave it to the last minute — the financial audit takes 14 days to complete at AED 3,000. Get it sorted well before your renewal date to avoid delays.

intents.name: LLC to Branch Conversion
intents.question: Can I convert LLC to Branch or vice versa?
responses: No, it's not possible to convert an LLC to a Branch or a Branch to an LLC at Meydan Free Zone. If you need a different company structure, you'd need to set up a new entity. The company also can't provide its own MOA, but you can request additions, removals, or edits to clauses in the Meydan MOA — subject to legal approval.

Converting between LLC and Branch structures isn't possible — you can't go from LLC to Branch or Branch to LLC. If you need a different structure, you'll have to incorporate a new company. Unfortunately, no. You cannot convert an LLC to a Branch or a Branch to an LLC. These are fundamentally different entity types. If your business needs change, you'd need to set up a new company with the desired structure.

intents.name: Shop Outside Free Zone
intents.question: Can I have a shop outside Meydan Free Zone?
responses: No, you cannot have a shop outside the Meydan Free Zone area. Your business premises must be within Meydan Free Zone. However, if you need mainland operations, you can apply for a DET (Department of Economy and Tourism) permit — but note that DET permits are not available with General Trading activity. Your company must hold one of the 44 approved mainland activities.

Shops must be within the Meydan Free Zone area only. If you need a physical presence on the mainland, you'll need a DET permit, which allows certain free zone companies to operate in mainland Dubai. Just note: General Trading activity is not eligible for DET permits — you'd need one of the 44 specific mainland activities.

No, your shop must be within the Meydan Free Zone area. For mainland operations, there's the DET permit option, but it requires specific activities (not General Trading). DET permits cover 44 approved mainland activities.

intents.name: Chamber of Commerce Certificate
intents.question: Will I get a Chamber of Commerce certificate?
responses: No, a Chamber of Commerce certificate is not automatically issued when you register with Meydan Free Zone. However, Meydan can assist you in registering with Dubai Chambers — that service costs AED 825 (service fee) plus AED 2,200 (authority fee). You'll get portal credentials and a company registration number.

A Chamber of Commerce certificate isn't included with your Meydan FZ registration. But we can help you register with Dubai Chambers for a service fee of AED 825 plus AED 2,200 authority fee. You'll receive a username, password for the portal, and your company registration number.

It's not automatically issued, but Meydan Free Zone can assist you in getting registered with the Chamber of Commerce. The registration costs AED 825 as a service fee plus AED 2,200 as the authority fee. We handle the whole process and provide you with portal access.

intents.name: Property Ownership Under Company
intents.question: Can I hold property under my Meydan Free Zone company?
responses: Yes, you can hold property under your Meydan Free Zone company. This is a great advantage for investors looking to acquire real estate through their business entity in Dubai.
Absolutely — your Meydan Free Zone company can hold property. Many clients use their company structure for property investments in Dubai.
Yes, property ownership under your Meydan Free Zone company is permitted. It's a popular option for investors looking to structure their real estate holdings through a corporate entity.

intents.name: Visa Allocations Available
intents.question: How many visa allocations does a company get?
responses: Each company gets 6 visa allocations. The visa allocation is the visa quota in immigration and must be obtained before applying for any employment or investor/partner visa. Both the immigration card and visa allocation have the same validity as the business license and need to be renewed annually along with it.

You get 6 visa allocations per company. These represent your immigration visa quota and must be secured before processing any employment or investor visas. The visa allocation validity matches your business license, so they renew together.

6 visa allocations come with your company. This is your immigration quota — required before you can apply for employment or investor/partner visas. Important: visa allocations share the same validity as your license and need annual renewal, even if you obtained them mid-year.

intents.name: Immigration Card Explained
intents.question: What is an immigration card?
responses: The immigration card is what registers your company details in the immigration system. It's mandatory — you must have it before applying for any employment or investor/partner visas. The immigration card has the same validity as your business license and needs to be renewed alongside it. If it expires, there's a penalty of AED 250 per month with no grace period.

An immigration card registers your company in the UAE immigration system. It's a mandatory step that comes before any visa processing — whether employment or investor visas. Its validity matches your business license, and there's no grace period if it expires (AED 250/month penalty).

intents.name: Company Name Change Timeline
intents.question: How long does a company name change take?
responses: A company name change takes 14 days for the publication period. After the name is changed, you must also apply for an immigration card amendment. There are no extra fees if you select 'Renewal with Amendment' during license renewal — unless you're adding a 4th activity group.

The publication period for a company name change amendment is 14 days. Keep in mind you'll need to do an immigration card amendment afterwards too, since it must reflect the new company name. If you're combining the name change with your license renewal, there's no extra fee.

intents.name: Company MOA Rules
intents.question: Can a company provide its own MOA?
responses: No, companies can't provide their own Memorandum of Association. Meydan Free Zone provides the standard MOA. intents.name: Renewal with Amendment Fees

responses: No extra fees when you select 'Renewal with Amendment' during license renewal — unless you're adding a 4th activity group (which costs AED 1,000 per additional activity). Renewal with Amendment doesn't cost extra unless you're adding a 4th activity group. Multi-year license holders get a free amendment built in. It's the most cost-effective way to make changes — bundle them with your renewal.

intents.name: Corporate and Employee Letters Validity
intents.question: How long are corporate and employee letters valid?
responses: Corporate and employee letters from Meydan Free Zone are valid for 30 days from the date of issuance. Board resolutions have a shorter validity of 15 days during application submission on the portal. So make sure to time your document requests accordingly.

The validity is 30 days for both corporate and employee letters. Board resolutions are valid for 15 days during portal application submissions. Plan your timing carefully — don't request letters too far in advance of when you need them.

intents.name: Visa Allocation Renewal Rules
intents.question: Do visa allocations need annual renewal?
responses: Yes, visa allocations must be renewed annually along with your business license and immigration card — even if you obtained the visa allocation mid-year. The visa allocation validity matches the license expiry date, not the date it was issued. So it all renews together.

Visa allocations renew every year alongside your license. Even if you got your allocation halfway through the year, it still expires with your license. The immigration card, visa allocation, and business license all share the same validity period and should be renewed together.

Annual renewal is required. The visa allocation validity is tied to your license expiry date — not when you first got it. So even if you availed it mid-year, it expires with your license. Renew your license, immigration card, and visa allocation all at once.

intents.name: Immigration Card Amendment After Name Change

intents.name: Residence Visa and UAE Presence
intents.question: Do I need to be in the UAE to process a residence visa?
responses: You have the option to start the entry visa process from outside the UAE. The entry permit is valid for 60 days from issuance, so you have a comfortable window to enter the country.

intents.name: Entry Visa and Change of Status Validity

responses: Both the entry permit and change of status are valid for 60 days from the date of issuance. intents.name: Residence Visa Before Biometrics
intents.question: Can I get my residence visa before completing biometrics?
responses: Yes, you can submit the Residence Visa application through the portal and fill out and sign the Emirates ID declaration form to proceed with visa issuance before biometrics. Once the visa is issued, you have 60 days to complete the biometrics.

Yes! Submit your visa application through the portal and sign the Emirates ID declaration form. Your residence visa can then be issued before completing biometrics. You'll have a 60-day window to get the biometrics done after visa issuance.

intents.name: Investor Visa Age and Requirements
intents.question: What are the age requirements for an investor/partner visa?
responses: The minimum age for an investor/partner visa is 18 years, with no maximum age limit. You must have AED 50,000 share capital in the company to qualify. Before applying, make sure you have your immigration card and visa allocation in place.

You need to be at least 18 years old for an investor/partner visa — there's no upper age limit. The key requirement is AED 50,000 in share capital in the company. Also ensure your immigration card and visa allocation are set up before applying.

Minimum 18 years, no maximum age. The main financial requirement is AED 50,000 share capital in the company. Age isn't the barrier here — just meet the capital requirement and have your immigration card and visa allocation ready.

intents.name: Employee Visa Age Requirements

intents.name: License Package Cost
intents.question: How much does a Meydan Free Zone license cost?
responses: A new corporate license at Meydan Free Zone is AED 12,125. That's an all-in package — it covers your company formation, the trade license itself, one visa allocation, and a flexi desk. You also get 3 business activities included, so you're pretty much set to start operating right away.

intents.name: NOC Authority Specific Pricing
intents.question: How much does each NOC authority cost?
responses: NOC fees vary by authority. Here's the breakdown: DMA (Dubai Maritime Authority) — AED 825, 3-4 days. RERA (Real Estate Regulatory Agency) — AED 825, 2-5 days. MOCACE (Ministry of Economy) — AED 825, 4-10 days. DOPA (Dubai Police) — AED 825, 3-5 days. DCAA (Dubai Civil Aviation) — AED 1,100. DSC (Dubai Sports Council) — AED 1,100-5,800. RTA (Roads and Transport) — AED 1,100, 10-15 days. SIRA (Security Industry) — AED 1,200. KHDA (Knowledge and Human Development) — AED 18,000, 20 days. UAEMC (UAE Ministry of Economy) — AED 25,000, 15-20 days.

Each NOC authority has different pricing and timelines. Budget options: DMA, RERA, MOCACE, DOPA at AED 825 each (3-10 days). Mid-range: DCAA and DSC at AED 1,100, RTA at AED 1,100 (10-15 days), SIRA at AED 1,200. Premium: KHDA at AED 18,000 (20 days) for training courses, and UAEMC at AED 25,000 (15-20 days). DSC can also be AED 5,800 depending on service type. Timeline varies by authority.

Here's the NOC pricing per authority: DMA — AED 825 (3-4 days), RERA — AED 825 (2-5 days), MOCACE — AED 825 (4-10 days), DOPA — AED 825 (3-5 days), DCAA — AED 1,100, DSC — AED 1,100 to AED 5,800, RTA — AED 1,100 (10-15 days), SIRA — AED 1,200, KHDA — AED 18,000 (20 days, for training), UAEMC — AED 25,000 (15-20 days).
